# RFC-0001: Overall architectual structure

> **Version:** 0.1.0 | **Status:** normative | **Phase:** impl

---

## 1. Summary

### [RFC-0001:C-SUMMARY] Architectual Overview (Informative) <a id="rfc-0001c-summary"></a>

This RFC defines that the `crowdsource-rs` system uses a hexagonal architecture.

*Since: v0.1.0*

---

## 2. Specification

### [RFC-0001:C-HEX-ARCH] Hexagonal Architecture (Normative) <a id="rfc-0001c-hex-arch"></a>

Hexagonal architecture is about build for change.

In hexagonal architecture, everything is build around the domain(s) of the business logic wrapped in a service. And connected to the service are adapters, incoming (e.g. Http Server) and outgoing (e.g. databases, emails).

The point is that the domain(s) define interfaces (called `ports`) for adapters. This makes the system more testable, easier maintainable.

*Since: v0.1.0*

---

## 3. Scope

### [RFC-0001:C-SCOPE] Scope (Normative) <a id="rfc-0001c-scope"></a>

The `crowdsource-rs` system MUST use a hexagonal architecture.

*Since: v0.1.0*
